definitions.definition: Entire ; relating to the whole of something .
examples: The total book is rubbish from start to finish. The total number of votes cast is 3,270.
The Ackermann function is one of the simplest and earliest examples of a total computable function that is not primitive recursive .

definitions.definition: Left total : Such that for every x in X there is a y in Y with x R y .
labels: of a relation R on X × Y
definitions.label_groups: mathematics , more generally , of a relation R on X × Y

definitions.definition: Such that any two elements are comparable, i.e. for all a and b , either a ≤ b , or b ≤ a .

main_definition: Entire ; relating to the whole of something .
secondary_definitions: ( used as an intensifier ) Complete ; absolute .
( mathematics , of a function ) Defined on all possible inputs .
( mathematics , more generally , of a relation R on X × Y ) Left total : Such that for every x in X there is a y in Y with x R y .
( mathematics , of a partial order ≤ ) Such that any two elements are comparable, i.e. for all a and b , either a ≤ b , or b ≤ a .
